CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 14, 1945, pg. 1 reads: "In Action ! - Pittsburgh joined the parade for democracy this week as colored men began training to become street car and bus operators...Elphair Nesson, 1845 Bedford Avenue, acts as motorman, while Thomas Madden, Pittsburgh Railways instructor, teaches him what the trolley controls mean. The men will undergo a twenty-eight day training period, and then will be assigned to regular runs. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Railways instructor Thomas Madden, observing Elphair Neeson training to operate streetcar at Castle Shannon trolley barn
